clues.clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows currency on the monitor.)  At the top of each bill are the words "this note is..." this two-word phrase "...for all debts public and private"
(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows currency on the monitor.)  The back of every dollar bears the front & reverse of the image designed in part by Ben Franklin & known by this two-word name
(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows currency on the monitor.)  At the end of the 19th century, the U.S. issued a $1 bill featuring her, the only woman ever to appear on a U.S. currency note

(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows currency on the monitor.)  The letter inside the circle indicates which one of the 12 Federal Reserve banks issued the dollar, from "A" for Boston all the way to "L" for the bank in this West Coast city

clues.answer: the Secretary of the Treasury & the Treasurer of the United States

final_jeopardy.clue: In the Red Star in 1976, Capt. Yuri Gavrilov coined this nickname for a U.K. politician who had made a speech against the USSR
